description:
doc: update Effective Go init section

Goroutines are no longer excluded from init.

Fixes issue 3232.

messages.text:
Hello golang-dev@googlegroups.com,

I'd like you to review this change to
https://code.google.com/p/go/

LGTM
- gri

On Wed, Mar 7, 2012 at 7:14 AM,  <rsc@golang.org> wrote:
> Reviewers: golang-dev_googlegroups.com,
>
> Message:
> Hello golang-dev@googlegroups.com,
>
> I'd like you to review this change to
> https://code.google.com/p/go/
>
>
> Description:
> doc: update Effective Go init section
>
> Goroutines are no longer excluded from init.
>
> Fixes issue 3232.
>
> Please review this at http://codereview.appspot.com/5764044/

*** Submitted as http://code.google.com/p/go/source/detail?r=5f2c911ed43a ***

doc: update Effective Go init section

Goroutines are no longer excluded from init.

Fixes issue 3232.

R=golang-dev, gri
CC=golang-dev
http://codereview.appspot.com/5764044

Don't we also have to update the effective_go.tmpl document? ie shouldn't the CL include both effective_go.html and effective_go.tmpl?

On 2012/03/07 16:38:42, rsc wrote:
> *** Submitted as http://code.google.com/p/go/source/detail?r=5f2c911ed43a ***
> 
> doc: update Effective Go init section
> 
> Goroutines are no longer excluded from init.
> 
> Fixes issue 3232.
> 
> R=golang-dev, gri
> CC=golang-dev
> http://codereview.appspot.com/5764044

Thank you.

Can we please move the tmpl stuff into godoc?
It seems silly to be maintaining parallel files
when godoc is already using the template package
and can run this itself while serving.

subject: code review 5764044: doc: update Effective Go init section
